attributes.action: Make the British Empire a compulsory part of the school curriculum
attributes.additional_details:
The British Empire had a huge impact around the globe, and it's effects can be seen and are relevant today. However, very few people are aware of anything more than a vague outline. 

We cannot fully understand ourselves and the world we live in today if we do not connect with our past. 

Though there may be things in our past that make us uncomfortable, we can only make positive changes if we are honest and open.
attributes.background: I would like the government to make it compulsory for schools to cover the British Empire and its impacts in the history curriculum for primary and secondary pupils.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Add education on diversity and racism to all school curriculums: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323808

Making the UK education curriculum more inclusive of BAME history: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323961

Teach Britain's colonial past as part of the UK's compulsory curriculum: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324092

We have also published several petitions about race and equality more widely, which you can view here: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions?state=open&topic=race-and-equality
